DataElement.preferredName: Image Optical Reconstruction Diameter Float or Fixed-point Millimeter Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The process of generating an image from the raw data, or set of unprocessed measurements, made by an imaging system._Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference._DS MM: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number measured in millimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The process of generating an image from the raw data, or set of unprocessed measurements, made by an imaging system._Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of generating an image from the raw data, or set of unprocessed measurements, made by an imaging system. (from AmershamHealth Medcyclopaedia):The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: The process of generating an image from the raw data, or set of unprocessed measurements, made by an imaging system. (from AmershamHealth Medcyclopaedia)
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/26/09 corrected "reconstruction" concept to C19339 (Image Reconstruction".   5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS MM: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number measured in millimeters.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number that can have its decimal point in any position.:A real number with a fixed number of digits following the decimal or radix point.:A unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter. (NCI):Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number that can have its decimal point in any position.
A real number with a fixed number of digits following the decimal or radix point.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/20/10 added Fixed Point CUI per VCDE review.   6/29/09 add mm as UOM 6/21/09 created for UOM Specific VD for DICOM DS Value Representation type to load NCIA v4.4 model.  10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  12/31/07 - chg long & short name to reflect "floating" aspect of value domain as indicated in the definition; semantics and max/min length did not change.  6/8/07-typo in def corrected.  6/4/07-Removed 15 decimal requirement.  5/10/07- Changed long to match Rep term qualifiers.  1/6/07-released VD so it can be reused in other imaging CDE.  1/4/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/21/10 VD 2903362 superceded with VD 3113181.  New VD added "Fixed Point" CUI per VCDE caBIG standard review.  VERSIONED 10/12/10 CDE versioned using VD 3113181 which superceded VD 2903362.  New VD developed as a result of the NBIA silver review recommendations  10/12/10 CDE versioned using VD 3113181 developed as a result of the NBIA silver review recommendations to replace prior VD version.    RETIRED ARCHIVED 10/12/10 CDE retired and versioned to use new VD 3113181 developed as a result of the NBIA silver review recommendations.   10/12/10 CDE versioned using VD 3113181 developed as a result of the NBIA silver review recommendations to replace prior VD version.  8/26/09  updated reconstruction concept (C19339) per NCIA VCDE Silver Review comments.  3/18/08 - updated with latest verson of VD.  no type or size change
